It seems that whenever I want to write here something happens and I need to rewrite everything again! PMO! Well the super crunch for finals is almost on me, I've been non studious the last few days, feeling a mental breakdown, yesterday I read an entire text book, but I'm not entirely sure how much of that I retained, I have to make notes today YAY, so that's what I'm doing today... This morning I woke up estatic because Celine's new album is out this morning. It is good, but there's not much Celine in it, but it is a welcomed change, but I only wish she would do stuff like her last album (A new day has come) it was from the heart, natural feeling, and my most favourite thing is that it felt like she had reached some greater state of enlightenment and spirituality that made me fall in love with her all over again and it made me feel at peace with myself, especially in "I'm Alive" (even though the video was a horrible sell out to the American film industry lacking complete imagination or thought - she was locked up inside a machine claiming to be alive - the remix was good) "A new day has come" was incredible as well as "Right infront of you", and the slow version of "A new day", "Have you ever been in love" and Etta James' "At last" and the amazing "I surrender" and then there was "Ten days" that the background vocals were comical. Oh and I can't forget about "Prayer" that was amazing, especially the line "If you can trust just one more time". This album is very Britney Spear-esque, which is never a good thing, but it's not entirely meaningless like Britney's lack-of-talent vocals drone out. It still sounds like songs Celine would sing, is singing, It's sort of Celine chante Avril Lavigne et Britney Spears, but so much more feeling and talent. It does have 3 previously released songs on it though :( One is a remix of last year's album. The is some punk/rock, pop, even R&B and humour that only avid Celine fans can catch. I love it anyways, because I feel it is a welcomed attempt at sounding different and proving that she is not just an adult contemporary chanteuse. I love "Coulda Woulda Shoulda" it is catchy and quick, but also one of the songs released on the Team Celine's version of "A New Day has Come". "One heart" is lively and flowing, I don't understand exactly what's going on in "Love is all we need" I talks about some girl who lives in a house that appears to be happy but is not and she wears lots of make up and sunglasses to cover up something that happened with the stairs at Macy's department store, so I'm thinking abuse of some sort, but then the chorus says "I don't understand the concept of the power of one is stronger" WTH?!? It's a good comment of society only caring about themselves though! I'll talk about it more later :P I'm making this one a long one, and one day I may very well figure out what going on with my FTP server and be able to actually post this for someone to read... Anyways... pray for peace and the fall of rome (USA) HUGS DAN :)
